<title level="1" right="Rules">[Inappropriate Skills](/Rules.aspx?ID=839)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 12</row>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
As described in the [_Core Rulebook_ on page 498](/Rules.aspx?ID=532), you can allow PCs to roll skills other than Perception (or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) when [Avoiding Notice](/Actions.aspx?ID=511)) for initiative. You might find that once a player gets to use a stronger skill for initiative, they’ll keep trying to use it for future encounters. As long as the narrative plays out in a reasonable manner, it’s fine to allow the skill. If you find that they start making up odd circumstances to use their pet skill, or that their justifications for using the skill take too long at the table, just tell them you’d like them to go back to using Perception for a while.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
